item.title: 'Heinous direct assault' on firefighters kills at least 2 in north Idaho
item.description: Authorities said a fire was reported Sunday afternoon in Coeur d'Alene and that firefighters began taking gunfire shortly after. It's unclear how many suspects were involved. No one is in custody.

item.title: Marchers cap Pride Month with celebration and protest
item.description: In New York City, large throngs of people celebrated as the parade went down Fifth Avenue to downtown. Many of them also demonstrated against President Trump's policies targeting transgender people.

item.title: Are seed oils good or bad for health? Here's what we know
item.description: Health secretary RFK Jr. has said seed oils, like canola, soybean and sunflower oil are 'poisoning Americans.' But many researchers say the evidence doesn't back up the claims.

item.title: Alone in Tehran, a young Iranian turns to ChatGPT and video games for comfort
item.description: A young shop manager living alone in Iran's capital was panicking during the war with Israel. Her family wasn't nearby. Her therapist had fled. So she turned to an AI chat bot.

item.title: Deadline nears for Taiwan's Chinese immigrants to prove no China household registration
item.description: Amid a wave of national security measures, immigrants from China must prove they've given up their household registration in China by June 30. Many are Chinese women married to men from Taiwan.
